netscreenPolicyMibModule.name: netscreenPolicyMibModule

revisions.description: Converted to SMIv2 by Longview Software

netscreenPolicyMibModule.contactinfo: Customer Support 1194 North Mathilda Avenue Sunnyvale, California 94089-1206 USA Tel: 1-800-638-8296 E-mail: customerservice@juniper.net HTTP://www.juniper.net
netscreenPolicyMibModule.description: This module defines NetScreen private MIBs for Policy Monitoring

nsPlyTable.name: nsPlyTable
nsPlyTable.description: A firewall provides a network boundary with a single point of entry and exit-a choke point.You can screen and direct all that traffic through the implementation of a set of access policies. Access policies allow you to permit, deny, encrypt, authenticate, prioritize, schedule, and monitor the traffic attemption to cross your firewall. This table collects all the policy configuration information existing in NetScreen Device.

nsPlyEntry.name: nsPlyEntry
nsPlyEntry.description: Each entry in the nsPlyTable holds a set of configuration parameters associatied with an instance of policy.

nsPlyId.name: nsPlyId
nsPlyId.description: Each policy is identified by a unique policy ID.

nsPlyVsys.name: nsPlyVsys
nsPlyVsys.description: Vitural system's name this polic entry belongs to.

nsPlySrcZone.name: nsPlySrcZone
nsPlySrcZone.description: Traffic through a firewall means that traffic flows from one security zone to another. This object describes the source zone name traffic flow passes.

nsPlyDstZone.name: nsPlyDstZone
nsPlyDstZone.description: Traffic through a firewall means that traffic flows from one security zone to another. This object describes the destination zone name traffic flow passes.

nsPlySrcAddr.name: nsPlySrcAddr
nsPlySrcAddr.description: Addresses are objects that identify network devices such as hosts and networks by their location in relation to the firwall on which security zone.To create an access policy for specific addresses, you must first create entries for the relevant hosts and networks in the address book.Source IP address indicates the address in source zone, 0.0.0.0 means any address.

nsPlyDstAddr.name: nsPlyDstAddr
nsPlyDstAddr.description: Addresses are objects that identify network devices such as hosts and networks by their location in relation to the firwall-on which security zone.To create an access policy for specific addresses, you must first create entries for the relevant hosts and networks in the address book.Source IP address indicates the address in destination zone, 0.0.0.0 means any address.

nsPlyService.name: nsPlyService
nsPlyService.description: Sevices are objects that identify application protocols using layer 4 information such as standard and accepted TCP and UDP port numbers for application services like Telnet, FTP, SMTP and HTTP. This object indicates all the traffic service type this policy allows. 'Any' means all this policy allows all service go through. 'Other' could be a configured service or not in the list. See nsPlyServiceName for service name.

nsPlyAction.name: nsPlyAction
nsPlyAction.description: Actions objects that describe what the firewall does to the traffic it receives. Permit allows the packet to pass the firewall. Deny blocks the packet from traversing the firewall. Tunnel encapsulates outgoing IP packets and decapsulates incoming IP packets.

nsPlyNat.name: nsPlyNat
nsPlyNat.description: You can apply NAT at the interface level or at the policy level. With policy-based NAT, you can translate the source address on either incoming or outging network and VPN traffic. This object indicates if this is a policy-based NAT.

nsPlyFixPort.name: nsPlyFixPort
nsPlyFixPort.description: When in policy-based NAT, the new secure address can come from either a Dynamic IP or from a Mapped IP. This object indicates if poliy-based NAT uses fix port when working on NAT mode.

nsPlyDipId.name: nsPlyDipId
nsPlyDipId.description: This object indicates the Dynamic ID chosen for NAT policy.

nsPlyVpnTunnel.name: nsPlyVpnTunnel
nsPlyVpnTunnel.description: VPN tunnel this access policy applies to.

nsPlyL2tpTunnel.name: nsPlyL2tpTunnel
nsPlyL2tpTunnel.description: L2TP tunnel this access policy applies to.

nsPlyAuth.name: nsPlyAuth
nsPlyAuth.description: This object indicates the selecting this option requires the user at the source address to authenticate his/her identiry by supplying a user name and password before traffic is allowed to graverw the firewall or enter the VPN tunnel.

nsPlyLogEnable.name: nsPlyLogEnable
nsPlyLogEnable.description: When you enable logging in an access policy, the NetScreen device logs all connections to which that paticular access policy applies.

nsPlyCountEnable.name: nsPlyCountEnable
nsPlyCountEnable.description: When you enable counting in an access plicy, the NetScreen device counts the total number of bytes of traffic to which this access policy applies and records the informaiton in historical graphs.

nsPlyAlarmBPS.name: nsPlyAlarmBPS
nsPlyAlarmBPS.description: User can set a threshold that triggers an alarm when the traffic permitted by the access policy exceeds a specified number of bytes per second.

nsPlyAlarmBPM.name: nsPlyAlarmBPM
nsPlyAlarmBPM.description: User can set a threshold that triggers an alarm when the traffic permitted by the access policy exceeds a specified number of bytes per Minute.

nsPlySchedule.name: nsPlySchedule
nsPlySchedule.description: By associating a schedule to an access policy, you can determine when the access policy is in effect.

nsPlyTrafficShapeEnable.name: nsPlyTrafficShapeEnable
nsPlyTrafficShapeEnable.description: User can set parameters for the control and shaping of traffic for each access policy.

nsPlyDSEnable.name: nsPlyDSEnable
nsPlyDSEnable.description: Differentiated Services is a system for tagging traffic at a position within a hierarchy of priority.

nsPlyActiveStatus.name: nsPlyActiveStatus
nsPlyActiveStatus.description: Show the status of one policy entry.

nsPlyServiceName.name: nsPlyServiceName
nsPlyServiceName.description: Sevices name that identify application protocols using layer 4 information such as standard and accepted TCP and UDP port numbers for application services like Telnet, FTP, SMTP and HTTP. This object indicates all the traffic service type this policy allows. 'Any' means all this policy allows all service go through.

nsPlyMonTable.name: nsPlyMonTable
nsPlyMonTable.description: traffic information for the policy-based traffic.

nsPlyMonEntry.name: nsPlyMonEntry
nsPlyMonEntry.description: An entry holds a set of traffic counters of a specific policy.

nsPlyMonId.name: nsPlyMonId
nsPlyMonId.description: Policy Id, also used as index in this table

nsPlyMonPackPerSec.name: nsPlyMonPackPerSec
nsPlyMonPackPerSec.description: Packets go through this policy per second

nsPlyMonPackPerMin.name: nsPlyMonPackPerMin
nsPlyMonPackPerMin.description: Packets go through this policy per minute

nsPlyMonTotalPacket.name: nsPlyMonTotalPacket
nsPlyMonTotalPacket.description: total packets go through this policy

nsPlyMonBytePerSec.name: nsPlyMonBytePerSec
nsPlyMonBytePerSec.description: Bytes go through this policy per second

nsPlyMonBytePerMin.name: nsPlyMonBytePerMin
nsPlyMonBytePerMin.description: Bytes go through this policy per minute

nsPlyMonTotalByte.name: nsPlyMonTotalByte
nsPlyMonTotalByte.description: Total bytes go through this policy

nsPlyMonSessionPerSec.name: nsPlyMonSessionPerSec
nsPlyMonSessionPerSec.description: Sessions go through this policy per second

nsPlyMonSessionPerMin.name: nsPlyMonSessionPerMin
nsPlyMonSessionPerMin.description: Sessions go through this policy per minute

nsPlyMonTotalSession.name: nsPlyMonTotalSession
nsPlyMonTotalSession.description: Total Sessions go through this policy
